intro: Darniella cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica thistle, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Darniella cyrenaica produces yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
